::: {.cell}

:::



## Purpose

Importing data is the first step in the workflow. 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("NHANES")
install.packages("devtools")
```
:::



## First Setup the library:


::: {.cell autorun='false' completion='true'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(psych)
library(knitr)
library(tibble)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(scales)     # for number formatting like comma()
library(english)    # to convert numbers to words
library(stringr)    # for text functions like str_c()
library(NHANES)
```
:::



# Datasets

You will learn how to import different datasets:
- datasets in R packages `NHANES` and `YRBS`
- class dataset "health beliefs (cohort 11) collected in the Research Methods I (ANTH206) course
- team dataset "oralhealth"

## File Formats

- National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey dataset from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) using the the R package `NHANES`
- a .csv file format of the class dataset "health beliefs (cohort 11)" collected in the Research Methods I (ANTH206) course `select_data.csv`
- a .xlsx file format of the class dataset "health beliefs (cohort 11) collected in the Research Methods I (ANTH206) course `C11ProlificHealthBeliefs.xlsx`
- a .sav file format from SPSS of the FRI team project on oral health `10312024oralhealth.sav`. 


::: {.cell autorun='false' completion='true'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load your data
select_data <- read.csv("data/03152025ProlificHealthBeliefs.csv")

# displays structures of R objects
str(select_data)
```
:::






::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Install required packages
install.packages("NHANES")
install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages("GGally")
install.packages("iris")

# Load the packages
library(NHANES)
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)
```
:::


Now, you will view the structure of the NHANES data

```{webr-r}
# Load the data and view its structure
str(iris)

```
